title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10§ 1.11 - Right of entrance and inspection
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10§ 1.11 - Right of entrance and inspection

State Regulations

No person shall interfere with or obstruct the entrance to any house, building, vessel, or other premises by the State Commissioner of Health, or local health officer, or the authorized representative of either, in the discharge of his official duties; nor shall any person interfere with or obstruct the inspection or examination of any occupant of any such house, building, vessel, or other premises by the State Commissioner of Health, or local health officer, or the authorized representative of either, in the discharge of his official duties. [FN*] See Penal Law, § 1741; Public Health Law, §§206, 324. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10§
1.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
